title: Introduction to the Knowledge Base
content: A knowledge base is a centralized repository for information. It can be used to store and retrieve knowledge in various formats.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: What are Web 2.0 tools?
content: Web 2.0 tools are online platforms that facilitate interactive information sharing and collaboration. Examples include wikis, blogs, and social media. Examples of Web 2.0 tools are: Google Docs, WordPress, Kahoot, YouTube, Canva, Slack, and many more.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: Understanding the eTwinning TwinSpace Homepage
content: The homepage of an eTwinning TwinSpace serves as the central hub for a collaborative project between schools and educators across Europe (and some neighboring countries). It's the starting point for all project-related activities and information sharing.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: Using the Pages Feature in eTwinning TwinSpace
content: The Pages feature in an eTwinning TwinSpace is one of the most important tools for organizing and presenting the collaborative work of the project. It functions like a website builder, allowing teachers and students to create structured, multimedia-rich content to showcase their activities, outcomes, and progress.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: Understanding the Materials Page in eTwinning TwinSpace
content: The Materials page of a TwinSpace in eTwinning is a central storage area where project participants can upload, organize, and access files related to their collaborative work. It serves as a repository for all project-related documents, resources, and materials, making it easier for team members to find and share important information.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: Using the Forum Feature in eTwinning TwinSpace
content: The Forum feature in an eTwinning TwinSpace is a powerful tool for facilitating communication and discussion among project participants. It allows teachers and students to engage in conversations, share ideas, ask questions, and provide feedback in a structured and organized manner.
author: eTwinning KB Team

title: Using the Members Feature in eTwinning TwinSpace
content: The Members feature in an eTwinning TwinSpace is a crucial component for managing and interacting with the participants of a collaborative project. It provides a platform for teachers and students to connect, communicate, and collaborate effectively.
author: eTwinning KB Team
